title: Mount

attr_timeout.description: Time for which file/directory attributes are cached

option.description: Option for libfuse/WinFsp (repeat if required). Can be specified with -o flag

fuse_flag.description: Flags or arguments to be passed direct to libfuse/WinFsp (repeat if required)

daemon.description: Run mount in background and exit parent process (as background output is suppressed, use --log-file with --log-format=pid,... to monitor) (not supported on Windows)

daemon_timeout.description: Time limit for rclone to respond to kernel (not supported on Windows). Defaults to 10 minutes on macOS, 0 on other systems

default_permissions.description: Makes kernel enforce access control based on the file mode (not supported on Windows)

allow_non_empty.description: Allow mounting over a non-empty directory (not supported on Windows)

allow_root.description: Allow access to root user (not supported on Windows)

allow_other.description: Allow access to other users (not supported on Windows)

async_read.description: Use asynchronous reads (not supported on Windows)

max_read_ahead.description: The number of bytes that can be prefetched for sequential reads (not supported on Windows)

write_back_cache.description: Makes kernel buffer writes before sending them to rclone (without this, writethrough caching is used) (not supported on Windows)

devname.description: Set the device name - default is remote:path

mount_case_insensitive.description: Tell the OS the mount is case insensitive (true) or sensitive (false) regardless of the backend (auto)

direct_io.description: Use Direct IO, disables caching of data

volname.description: Set the volume name (supported on Windows and OSX only)

noappledouble.description: Ignore Apple Double (._) and .DS_Store files (supported on OSX only)

noapplexattr.description: Ignore all "com.apple.*" extended attributes (supported on OSX only)

network_mode.description: Mount as remote network drive, instead of fixed disk drive (supported on Windows only)

daemon_wait.description: Time to wait for ready mount from daemon (maximum time on Linux, constant sleep time on OSX/BSD) (not supported on Windows). Defaults to 60s on Linux, 5s on BSD/macOS, 0 on other systems

$comment: Platform-specific options are marked in their descriptions. Windows does not support: daemon, daemon_timeout, daemon_wait, default_permissions, allow_non_empty, allow_root, allow_other, async_read, max_read_ahead, write_back_cache. macOS-only: noappledouble, noapplexattr. Windows-only: network_mode.
